H0.text: Line graph is the best way to report the students’ findings of elevation changes measured in a large park near their school.

H1.text: A topographic map is the best way to report the students' measured elevation changes in a large park near their school.

H2.text: Color‑coded chart is the best way to report students’ elevation changes measured in a large park near their school.

H3.text: Spreadsheet data table is the best way to report the students’ measurements of elevation changes in a large park near their school.

A4.text: Topographic maps conventionally show topography, or land contours, by means of contour lines.

A5.text: Topographic maps are characterized by large-scale detail and quantitative representation of relief features, usually using contour lines.
